data.event: Formerly named "Hart's Bottom", "Green Forest" or "Green Valley" until 1888, and chartered as a town in 1890, Buena Vista was granted a city charter on February 15, 1892.
Formerly named "Hart's Bottom", "Green Forest" or "Green Valley" until 1888, and chartered as a town in 1890, Buena Vista was granted a city charter on February 15, 1892.
In 1882 Appold & Sons Tannery opened, and the first public school opened in 1885.
In 1882 Appold & Sons Tannery opened, and the first public school opened in 1885.
